title: Labelexpo 2023: Heidelberg and Gallus showcase three new products - printweek
summary: Heidelberg and its subsidiary Gallus showcased new digital solutions at Labelexpo Europe 2023 that enhance automation in the print industry and address challenges like skilled labor shortages. The innovations aim to increase productivity and reduce waste, with the Gallus One digital label press and the Gallus ECS 340 flexo press featuring a digital printing unit as key highlights. The solutions incorporate cloud-based technologies and are designed to optimize the total cost of ownership for companies seeking cost-effective, sustainable digital labels. Additionally, the Heidelberg Customer Portal promises to save customers time and money while enhancing productivity with future AI capabilities.
green_innovation: TRUE, these innovations promote automation, increase productivity, reduce waste, and lead to more sustainable practices in the print industry.
business_innovation: TRUE, the introduction of new digital label presses and the Gallus ECS 340 flexo press demonstrate significant improvements in products and processes that were not previously offered by the company.
green_product: TRUE, the Gallus One digital label press offers sustainable, high-quality digital labels designed to reduce environmental impact.
green_process: TRUE, the new digital solutions and the Heidelberg Customer Portal contribute to minimizing waste and optimizing operational efficiency, qualifying them as green processes.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 323115 - Digital Printing; 323111 - Commercial Lithographic Printing; 322223 - Satellite, Telecommunications, and Other Communications Equipment Manufacturing; 511210 - Software Publishers
greenwashing: FALSE, there is no indication of misleading claims regarding the environmental benefits of the products presented at Labelexpo; the focus is on tangible innovations aimed at reducing waste and promoting sustainability.

title: Ashok Chaturvedi unveils report on recyclability of multi-layered aseptic packaging - printweek
summary: UFlex released a study on recycling multi-layered aseptic packaging and discussed their investment in enzymatic delamination technology that allows for the recycling of such packaging. The company aims to promote sustainability through advanced recycling processes and invites stakeholders to learn about their efforts. They emphasize the importance of regulatory support to boost recycling initiatives in India. UFlex strives to demonstrate that plastic packaging can align with economic and environmental sustainability.
green_innovation: TRUE: This is considered green innovation as it involves the development and implementation of recycling technology that significantly reduces the environmental impact of multi-layer aseptic packaging, contributing to a circular economy.
business_innovation: TRUE: The creation and utilization of enzymatic delamination technology represent a new and improved process for recycling packaging, which significantly differs from traditional approaches, hence qualifying as business innovation.
green_product: FALSE: The article does not specifically mention a green product being marketed; it focuses on the process of recycling packaging materials.
green_process: TRUE: The enzymatic delamination technology described in the article is a green process as it minimizes environmental impact and promotes sustainability by enabling the recycling of complex packaging materials.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: [3261 - Plastics Product Manufacturing, 3222 - Converted Paper Product Manufacturing, 5417 - Scientific Research and Development Services, 5621 - Waste Management and Remediation Services]
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not suggest any misleading practices or exaggerations regarding UFlex's environmental efforts; instead, it provides a detailed account of their genuine initiatives in the field of sustainable packaging technology.
